result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L Stuart

defendant.name: Stuart, Michelle L
defendant.address: 913 N Spring St., Apt 213, Beaver Dam, WI 53916

records.addlTxt:
8:34 AM  Defendant Michelle L Stuart appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Michelle L Stuart.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CF406, 21CF357, 21CM88, 21CM146, 22CF128, 22CT171, 21CT26, 22TR3183

Atty Rivard - global resolution contains Branch 2 cases as well. 
State - plea to amended Count 1 in 21CF357. Moves to DRI all remaining cases and counts. Wheld sentence - 4 years probation. 365 days conditional jail. 95 days served up front. 270 days held in abeyance for use by agent. Follow recommendations of agent, Restitution of $100 + mandatory surcharges in 21CF406. Costs of $538. Victim rights have been complied with.
DE - waives her personal appearance.  Atty Rivard - that is the agreement.  DE - understands agreement. Speaks of money ceased - asks if it can be applied to court costs.  Parties have no objection to money ceased being applied to court costs.
Court - provides plea colloquy.
DE - enters No Contest plea in Count 1 of 21CF357.
Parties stipulate to the facts
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts plea and finds DE guilty. Asks State to file 2nd Amended Information
State - asks court to accept joint recommendation. No PSI requested.   Atty Rivard - agrees court should accept joint recommendation. Asks that DE be allowed to serve jail in Dodge County and that Huber be allowed.  Parties agree to jail credit of 208 days.  DE - makes statement to the court.

Court orders - $483.00 ceased is to be applied to court costs.
21CF357 - Count 1
Withheld sentence
4 years probation
208 days credit if revoked
365 days conditional jail 
95 days served up front 
270 days held in abeyance for use by agent 
May serve jail in another County at no cost to Dunn County, WI
Huber allowed
No objection to electronic monitoring for conditional jail time
Must report to jail on or before December 30, 2022
Must be evaluated for programming
Follow programming recommendations of agent 
Restitution of $100 + mandatory 10% surcharge and 5% surcharge 
Restitution payments to begin by December 1, 2022
Submit DNA sample
May not possess firearm or vote until civil rights are restored
Costs of $538 

21CF357 Counts 2,3,4,5 - DRI
21CF406 - DRI for purposes of restitution
21CM88, 21CM146, 22CF128, 22CT171, 21CT26, 22TR3183 - DRI

8:34 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle L Stuart appeared by video.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Michelle L Stuart. A. Standaert - Clerk 

Atty Rivard - waives further reading, enters NG plea
Court - schedules return date
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
